name: Q1 Cold Email Campaign - FB Ads Prospects
hypothesis: Personalized cold email campaign targeting FB/IG advertisers will achieve >= 10% reply rate

batches.name: New Prospects (Exa MCP Research)
batches.excluded_reason: sirisha.deevi@sothebys.com is IT engineer at auction house, not realtor
batches.bounce_notes: david@homesusa.com - wrong persona (Software Consultant at B2B tech company, not realtor)

batches.name: New Composer A/B Test
changes: Question-based CTAs instead of 'Would you be open to'
Genuine curiosity tone vs sales robot

timeline.note: 21 new emails drafted with Exa MCP research
3 name mismatches fixed, ready to send
Removed sirisha.deevi@sothebys.com - IT engineer at auction house, not realtor
69 follow-up emails drafted for Batch 1 non-responders
45 personalized emails drafted for recovered contacts
24 fixes applied (20 name fixes, 4 greeting fixes)
21 new bounces detected, 3 potential replies (Bob Woerner, Signarama, Moxi Works)
2 replies received - both unsubscribe requests (Bob Woerner, Donald McVicar). Added to do_not_contact.csv
Analyzed 0% positive reply rate - identified templated pitch as likely cause
Rewrote composer.py: removed STANDARD_OFFER, added question-based CTAs, shorter emails
6 emails drafted with new composer approach (new_v2)
6 emails sent - new composer A/B test batch
49 value-add follow-ups drafted for batches 2 & 3 (new approach - stats/insights, not 'following up')
Verification passed - 0 critical issues, 3 false positive domain warnings
49 value-add follow-ups sent (30 batch 2 + 19 batch 3) - 0 failures
0 new bounces, 0 new human replies. Batch 5 and value-add follow-ups still pending responses.

next_action.description: Monitor batch_5 (new composer) and value-add follow-ups for responses

issues_encountered.cause: lahaus.ai strict DMARC policy, sent via lahaus.com SMTP
issues_encountered.result: Fix did not work - needed bounce recovery with alternative addresses

issues_encountered.cause: Email domains unrelated to company names
issues_encountered.result: Improved email quality, reduced bounce risk

issues_encountered.cause: sothebys.com is auction house domain, not sothebysrealty.com (real estate)
issues_encountered.fix: Removed from batch 3 after Exa research confirmed IT engineer, not realtor
issues_encountered.result: Prevented sending to completely wrong recipient

issues_encountered.issue: High bounce rate on recovered emails (47%)
issues_encountered.cause: Generic emails (info@, contact@) often catch-all but don't deliver; accept_all domains may still reject
issues_encountered.fix: Need to verify recovered emails before sending, or use personal emails only

issues_encountered.issue: Follow-up emails triggered unsubscribes (100% of replies)
issues_encountered.cause: Follow-up #1 may feel too pushy; 'Quick follow-up' subject line perceived as sales pressure
issues_encountered.fix: Consider softer follow-up approach, longer wait time, or value-add content instead of reminder

learnings_so_far: DMARC issues require sender domain alignment, not just alias change
Domain mismatch check prevents sending to wrong recipients
Email verification pipeline reduces critical issues by 79%
Exa MCP tool provides better research when script-based Exa API quota is exhausted
For franchise agents (RE/MAX, Coldwell Banker, etc.), research should find agent's personal/team website, not franchise homepage
Verify sothebys.com vs sothebysrealty.com - auction house vs real estate franchise are different companies
LLM-powered writing quality check catches spam triggers and awkward phrasing that regex misses
Cold email CTAs should focus on the problem being solved, not product claims
Generic emails (info@, contact@) have ~50% secondary bounce rate even when verified as accept_all
Bounce recovery is more effective with Hunter/Apollo personal emails than generic emails
Some domains (keyrealtyschool.com, idealista.com, reddoorrealtyandassociates.com) consistently bounce all variants - may be blocking cold outreach
Follow-up emails with 'Quick follow-up' subject triggered 100% unsubscribe rate - consider value-add approach instead of reminder
Both unsubscribes came from follow-up #1 (3 days after initial), not from initial emails - timing or tone issue
100% templated pitch (STANDARD_OFFER) likely caused 0% positive reply rate - emails felt robotic
New approach: question-based CTAs, shorter emails (50-70 words), genuine curiosity tone vs sales pitch
Batch 5 tests new composer - will compare reply rate vs batches 1-4 (old approach)
Value-add follow-ups lead with stats/insights instead of 'following up' - avoids pushy tone that triggered unsubscribes
